responses: 0: Yes. Subnational elections in some areas of the country are significantly more free and fair(or, alternatively, significantly less free and fair) than subnational elections in other areas of
1: Somewhat. Subnational elections in some areas of the country are somewhat more free and
fair (or, alternatively, somewhat less free and fair) than subnational elections in other areas of
2: No. Subnational elections in most or all areas of the country are equally free and fair (or, alternatively, equally not free and not fair).
citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
question: Does the freeness and fairness of subnational elections vary across different areas of the country?
